5.1.19  5:56 am   When you include screenshots in your reality videos, are these screenshots made on the spot for future use, or during the editing process to illustrate your point?

For instance, in your latest video, there is a screenshot of "script for history of world, i guess", when was it taken?

     the screenshot was taken during editing, but the document is from the actual time period. so it looks exactly the same, down to the pixel

5.1.19  2:36 am   why is this page slowly becoming life guru AMA????

     slowly becoming? was that from day one. mixed with all the other things it's still mixed with

5.1.19  12:33 am   one of my biggest problems when combining melody with chords is that ending a melodic phrase by going M3 -> 1 is one of the strongest sounding melodic resolutions, but the strongest harmonic resolutions I know (V7->I, bII7->I, iv6->I) all do not work well with the M3rd of the tonic chord included (at least when the blending is clear enough to hear the dissonance). I know V13 is a thing, but I always think that sounds weird unless the 7th is lower than the 13th, which usually makes the chord sound muddy.

The best way I've found is iii with the 5th of the tonic scale in the bass, but that never is quite as satisfying as I want it to be.

     if you are really saying the 3 to 1 melody is the strongest thing around, then surely you must have Heard it somewhere. how was it done there?

      Do you have a go-to for this situation? I know in And The Day Goes On, you just did a I chord with the 5th in the bass going to a normal I chord with lots of voices moving down and it totally worked there

     i can't tell which part you mean

      but like iii/5th

     you mean Emin over G, or Emin over B?

      it leaves me with a bit of harmonic blue balls when I try to apply it in general. 

     if Emin/G to Cmaj feels too lame and weak, you're gonna want to swap out the mid-range G for F. so you have G bass, then F B E over it. that's G13 but maybe you haven't tried it that way? that can be made crunchier if you also add Ab in there. that might actually remind you of the 1930s. but none of this means anything without the entirety of what else is happening in the song. most songs are not just those 2 notes, no words, etc

5.1.19  12:17 am   do you have any regrets at this point?

     i wish i did

4.30.19  10:27 am   I have a theory that everyone is everyone else. Like, you have person A and B, and A thinks it's A and not B, and B thinks it's B and not A. But A and B are in the brain of person C (or you can think of it like C is reading the minds of both A and B). So C has the experience of thinking it's A and not B, and thinking it's B and not A, and maybe independent C thoughts not in A or B.
Maybe people are like A and B, but we're all just C. Helps to explain why I feel like me and not like someone else. Any constructive criticism on this theory?

     the thesis (first sentence) seemed strong, but the explanation didn't seem clear to me. C reads minds? ? the explanation seemed to demonstrate that some people read minds and others do not . ... which doesn't seem to connect to the original statement .....

4.30.19  8:27 am   Would the tradition grip allow me to have enough power to hit the snare drum for rock music,

     sure

      or would I have to use a different grip?

     according to the geological rock-snare index, a hardness of 3.7 is required for the snare. this can be obtained with traditional grip as long as your experience level is at a 6.9 on the hendersen's experience index

     Which grip would you use the loud rock music? 

     i would use trad but maybe slightly thicker sticks, and if the part is super simple with like no little ghosties then i would flip the stick around backwards and matched, maybe. but that would be only if the mic amplification is registering at 2.8 or lower, from audience level metering
